key_points: Evidence suggests the attack on the US Capitol was planned, involving weapons and tactics.
The FBI is examining evidence that some Trump rally participants may have left early to retrieve items for the assault.
Investigators are using counterterrorism strategies, focusing on travel and communications records.
Corruption prosecutors are involved due to their expertise in financial investigations, following the money.
The FBI has received over 126,000 digital tips regarding the Capitol attack.
Among the tips are claims showing members of Congress with riot participants, under investigation for veracity.
Arrests made using counterterrorism strategies, including minimal charges to remove potential threats.
Henry "Enrique" Tarrio and Eduard Florea were arrested on charges linked to the Capitol riot.
Prosecutors and the FBI are encouraging participants to turn themselves in for leniency.
DC US Attorney Michael Sherwin indicated a comprehensive approach, comparing the investigation to counterterrorism operations.
